text:
Shrek becomes a startlingly intense dark fantasy where the fairy-tale world turns vicious and unpredictable. The film’s surreal creatures and twisted landscapes take on a menacing tone, and its bursts of unexpectedly graphic violence make it far more disturbing than its colourful exterior suggests—certainly not suitable for all viewers.

Shrek himself becomes a brooding, volatile figure, misunderstood but undeniably dangerous, while the quest through forests, castles, and swamps feels more like a descent into a realm where every joke hides sharp teeth. Even the film’s humour gains a sinister edge, giving the story an uncanny blend of menace and absurdity.

Strange, violent, and unexpectedly gripping, this version of Shrek plays like a fairy tale told around a campfire to frighten rather than comfort—and it works.

Watched it again, after an absence of four or five years (saw it at the cinema when it came out) because of feeling low. OK, the animation looks a tad dated, but there are "fashionable" Oscar winners with less heart, cleverness, truth and laugh out loud moments than this.  A total joy.

One of the best animated films in the world. Shrek and Donkey are a exceptionally funny duo and work perfectly together. The film has plenty of jokes that will make anyone laugh and a simple but very enjoyable plot.

Honestly an amazing movie. Not only enjoyable for kids, but parents too. It's funny, has a good plot, amazing characters, and so many other reasons that Shrek is an amazing movie. This is also just one of those movies everyone knows and has seen so it's a must watch.

Wow, wow, wow. I have no words of how to describe how good this film is. Everything about it: the animation, the way the characters acted, even the music. This is hands down the best animated film of all time. From the grumpy yet charming ogre Shrek to the hilarious chatty Donkey, the characters are just the beginning. We also get jokes referencing rhymes and fairy tale things, like the muffin man and the three blind mice. Also a pretty deep story, while subverting the common tropes. 
The animation is very good for 2001 and still holds up in many ways nowadays (minus the characters, though). Music is just wonderful, especially with all those great pop songs thrown in there. And finally...keep out of my swamp!
I definitely recommend you seeing it if you didn't already; it's something you can't miss!

Shrek is a hilarious and heart-warming animated film that turns fairy tale tropes on their head. With memorable characters, witty humour, and a surprising emotional depth, it’s a timeless classic that appeals to both kids and adults alike
